text: [MUSIC PLAYING]
Hi guys, it's Angel.

Today I'm going to show you
how to make a ginger scallion
beef stir fry.

Now, similar to my last video
on a five minute egg flower

soup, this recipe is a
great weeknight recipe

as well because you can
prepare, marinate, and cook it
in under 30 minutes or less.
So with that, let's get started.

First, let's start
with the beef.

We'll need about half a pound
of beef sirloin or top round.

Now, when you're out
grocery shopping,

try look for the pre-cut
thin slices of meat

that have been already cut
by your meat department.

Then all you need to do is
just cut them into thin strips.

This makes everything easier for
you when it comes time to prep.

Next, for the
marinade we'll need

two tablespoons of
low sodium soy sauce,

one teaspoon of sugar, two
teaspoons of cornstarch,

one tablespoon of rice wine,
two teaspoons of freshly

grated ginger, and finally a
generous amount fresh ground
pepper.

Mix everything really well,
then let that marinate
for 15 to 20 minutes.

While that's marinating,
let's go ahead
and prep the scallions.

I've got five to six
stalks of scallions,

and feel free to use
more if you like.

I feel like scallions
really make this dish,

so this is one of those
times where less is not more.

We'll want to start by
cutting three inch sections.

And if you need to,
slice the white portions

of the scallions in
half so it cooks evenly
with the top portions.
Now let's cook.

Bring a wok or non-stick
pan to medium high heat

and add a generous amount of
oil to your pan and a tablespoon

of oil to your marinade,
which will help coat
the beef prior to cooking.

Next, cook the meat and stir
fry until the beef has just

browned, and is
about halfway cooked.

Then add in your
scallions and continue

to stir fry for
another minute or two,

taking care not to
overcook the beef.

Finally, before serving
add a bit of salt to taste.

So that's how you make my
ginger scallion beef stir fry.

Now, since it's lunch time, I am
going to go ahead and try some
because I am super hungry.
And do the taste test.

So when you eat the
beef, make sure that you
get at least a scallion or two.
Mmmmm.

I love how tender the
beef was, and the flavors

of the ginger and the scallions
just taste perfect together.

I hope you guys
enjoyed this video.

Don't forget to give
me a thumbs up if you
thought this was easy.

And also, if you do
decide to make this dish,

please send me a photo
through social media.

I would love to see how
they turned out for you.

Thank you guys so
much for watching,
and I will see you guys soon.
Bye!
